action.action-desc: Mr. Huffman (for himself, Mr. Carbajal, and Mr. Neguse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to authorize the President to provide hazard mitigation assistance for mitigating and preventing post-wildfire flooding and debris flow, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Post-Fire Flooding and Debris Flow Act of 2022.

section.header: Amendments to improve hazard mitigation assistance

subsection.text: Section 404 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief And Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5170c) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking The President may contribute up to 75 percent of the cost and inserting The Federal share of assistance under this section shall be not less than 75 percent of the cost; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (13), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (14), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: with respect to any area affected by a wildfire, mitigating and preventing post-wildfire flooding and debris flow.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to assistance provided under section 404 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5170c) on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
